newsitem.title: JAPAN: NTT int'l business possible before 1999 - ministry.
newsitem.headline: NTT int'l business possible before 1999 - ministry.

text.p: Japan's Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications said on Monday that it would deal flexibly with plans by Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp (NTT) to start international business before 1999.

"NTT will be allowed to move into the international market even before its 1999 reorganisation, depending on the type of business it wants to do," Eiichi Tanaka, the ministry's senior advisor, told a news conference.
Asked about a comment by NTT president Junichiro Miyazu last Friday that the firm hoped to list shares of its future long-distance unit, Tanaka said:
"It would be a welcome thing if the holding company gradually reduces its holding in the long-distance unit."

On Friday, NTT and the ministry said the company would be reorganised into a holding company supervising the operations of three major units -- two regional companies and a long-distance carrier -- by around 1999.
The holding company will own 100 percent of the shares of the three units.
